tETE-PJax7_kpc3vP.notes: Once adrift in your own thoughts, you must roll against Perception-5 in order to notice any event short of personal physical injury

tCnNxYdjSJoZt8ssq.name: Impulsiveness
tCnNxYdjSJoZt8ssq.notes: Make a self-control roll whenever it would be wise to wait and ponder. If you fail, you must act

t9HZJAQVdkx07XBqJ.notes: Make a self-control roll when presented with an interesting item or situation
t9HZJAQVdkx07XBqJ.name: Curious

t8QYy4n_XeQm_gj0a.name: Post-Combat Shakes
t8QYy4n_XeQm_gj0a.notes: Make a self-control roll at the end of any battle. If you fail, roll 3d, add the amount by which you failed your self-control roll, and look up the result on the Fright Check Table.

features.situation: toward those you are jealous of (may be as much as -4, at GM's discretion)
from victims of your intolerance (may be as much as -5, at GM's discretion)

tn1AH2Hb9KDE_mpj9.name: Greed
tn1AH2Hb9KDE_mpj9.notes: Make a self-control roll any time riches are offered – as payment for fair work, gains from adventure, spoils of crime, or just bait. If you fail, you do whatever it takes to get the payoff.

features.situation: from others in any situation where No Sense of Humor becomes evident

tSCHoJW2knK5GeaB3.name: Lecherousness
tSCHoJW2knK5GeaB3.notes: Make a self-control roll whenever you have more than the briefest contact with an appealing member of the sex you find attractive, at -5 if this person is Handsome/Beautiful, or at -10 if Very Handsome/Very Beautiful. If you fail, you must make a “pass” using whatever wiles and skills you can bring to bear.

tzMI-Z5JEwYvKEAJq.notes: Make a self-control roll each day. If you fail, you must try to trick a dangerous subject: a skilled warrior, a dangerous monster, a whole group of reasonably competent opponents, etc. If you resist, you get a cumulative -1 per day to your self-control roll until you finally fail a roll!
tzMI-Z5JEwYvKEAJq.name: Trickster

features.situation: to IQ-based skills when alone, or only -1 if in a group of 4 or less

tzakkgCBIa9flDqEy.name: Short Attention Span
tzakkgCBIa9flDqEy.notes: Make a self-control roll whenever you must maintain interest in something for an extended period of time, or whenever a distraction is offered. If you fail, you automatically fail at the task at hand.

t1mMRFzQA1wgHV-wK.name: Loner
t1mMRFzQA1wgHV-wK.notes: Make a self-control roll whenever anyone lingers nearby, watches over your shoulder, etc. If you fail, you lash out at that person just as if you had Bad Temper.

tUqVT8bmInrVBznjg.name: Honesty
tUqVT8bmInrVBznjg.notes: Make a self-control roll when faced with the “need” to break unreasonable laws; if you fail, you must obey the law, whatever the consequences. If you manage to resist your urges and break the law, make a second self-control roll afterward. If you fail, you must turn yourself in to the authorities!

features.situation: to all skill rolls whenever you believe that the odds are against you or others expect you to fail (GM’s judgment)

t1t3CfvOybNRW-1hP.notes: Make a self-control roll whenever you must keep silent about an uncomfortable truth (lying by omission). Roll at -5 if you actually have to tell a falsehood! If you fail, you blurt out the truth, or stumble so much that your lie is obvious.
t1t3CfvOybNRW-1hP.name: Truthfulness

features.situation: to others on all Empathy, Body Language, and Psychology rolls to discern your intentions or the truth of your words
to others on IQ, Detect Lies, and Gambling rolls in any Quick Contest with your Acting, Fast-Talk, or Gambling skill when you try to lie or bluff

t7K6q8GiXIotC-9f5.name: Charitable
t7K6q8GiXIotC-9f5.notes: Make a self-control roll in any situation where you could render aid or are specifically asked for help, but should resist the urge
